title:
Enterprise only. The Basic Authentication plugin protects the access to selected endpoints using basic username and password credentials.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/enterprise/authentication/basic-authentication/

endpoints.title: Endpoints
endpoints.description:
An array with all the endpoints protected with basic authentication. Use `*` for all endpoints. The endpoints values must match with the declaration of endpoints in your configuration, including any {placeholders} in the path.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/enterprise/authentication/basic-authentication/

htpasswd_path.title: Path to htpasswd file
htpasswd_path.description:
Absolute Path to the htpasswd filename (recommended) or relative ./ to the workdir (less secure).

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/enterprise/authentication/basic-authentication/

users.title: Additional users
users.description:
Map with additional users to the htpasswd file can be declared directly inside the configuration. The content of both places will be merged (and will overwrite users already defined in the htpasswd file).

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/enterprise/authentication/basic-authentication/
